posts.post_content: honestly, you all are focused to much on what the card looks like and not what it can do. I run four in my vampire deck. all you have to do is run a bunch of weenies like pulse tracker and gruul draz vampire and the lacerator, and then turn three play the captivating it makes them stronger and anything they play that makes a big threat take it, i beat my friends white weenie deck all the time with this. because he will play baneslayer and i'll be like ok cool now i get a 5/5 angel vampire hybrid badass turn ur opponents strongest creatures against them. its a lot faster and more useful the the roil elemental. im just saying.

Posted By: stevieg91rules (8/14/2010 11:57:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I wonder how this card would have rated if it didn't have [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus) to live up to. I like this card; no, it's no Nocturnus, but sometimes players like rare cards that are under $5 instead of $15+ Mythics. He'll have a place in many more budget-friendly Vampire decks. And again, I wonder what people would say about him other than "Not a good repalcement for Nocturnus."  
  
@Diacrhonos: I will explain better. I *love* this card. 5/5. I only wonder how he would compare without Nocturnus around because the first half a dozen comments I read about this card said he sucked because of Nocturnus and ranted at Wizards for not reprinting the aforementioned Mythic Rare. I love him regardless of Nocturnus; I'd never play an expensive mythic rare anyway. Over $10 is beyond my desire to pay for a single card.
posts.html:
I wonder how this card would have rated if it didn't have Vampire Nocturnus to live up to. I like this card; no, it's no Nocturnus, but sometimes players like rare cards that are under $5 instead of $15+ Mythics. He'll have a place in many more budget-friendly Vampire decks. posts.post_content:
Wow...what great art...oh wait, I'm NOT a fourteen-year-old girl! FAIL!  
  
\*\*\*  
  
I said on [Barony Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barony Vampire)'s comments that these two cards need to swap art. Her looks and her stance make her look sort of coy and flirty, but in a cold, vampiric way (how you'd imagine a "Captivating Vampire").   
  
THIS dude, on the other hand, fits Barony Vampire's flavor text remarkably well. His whole mien exudes the "creepy, bad-touch predator" thing that BV's text seems to imply. I'd definitely not let this guy within 1000 feet of an elementary school.
posts.html:
Wow...what great art...oh wait, I'm NOT a fourteen-year-old girl! FAIL!

***

I said on Barony Vampire's comments that these two cards need to swap art. Her looks and her stance make her look sort of coy and flirty, but in a cold, vampiric way (how you'd imagine a "Captivating Vampire").

THIS dude, on the other hand, fits Barony Vampire's flavor text remarkably well. His whole mien exudes the "creepy, bad-touch predator" thing that BV's text seems to imply. I'd definitely not let this guy within 1000 feet of an elementary school.

posts.post_content:
I'm a just kid that plays MTG, so this is the kind of artwork that scares me. Seriously, what's he about to do with that hand? I think I know, for one...  
  
That being said, I find it to be a pretty good card (although, seeing that I'm a kid, and a very casual player, that probably doesn't mean nil). Also, stop comparing it to [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus), because they are definitely not the same. Last I checked, one of them is a $17 mythic rare, while the other is a $2 rare that looks like some sort of child molester.

Posted By: mrd8888 (10/2/2010 2:42:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
There is only one captivating vampire, and her name is [Drana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drana), she could seduce anyone to the dark side.
  
This one...
  
The art is obviously horrible (I think even girls would find this guy creepy), and his ability will rarely be usable in competitive play, and he cannot replace nocturnus (well duh, noc is a 15$ mythic, this is a 2$ rare), but 3 CMC for a 2/2 that gives all your other vamps +1/+1 is nice indeed, and this is what matters, the other factors are just not important. I'd still like to hear what went through the artist's head when he drew this though.

posts.post_content:
The only traditional tribe that even competes in standard is elves (you could say 'goblins' can currently compete in SOM, but really, Kuldotha Rebirth, Goblin Guide and Goblin Bushwhacker doesn't constitute a tribal deck IMO). Vampires isn't competing right now. It was somewhat competitive before Shards rotated, but even then, it was second or third tier because it just didn't have the versatility or sheer power of other decks in the format.  
  
In limited, he can actually be surprisingly good. In a day where I got an absolutely insane draft, the only game I dropped was to a black vamps deck - the guy opened this P1P1 and took as many vamps as possible after that. Considering I had insane removal in Pacifism, Quag Sickness, Condemn, Blinding Mage... and not to mention my all star team of Sun Titan and Royal Assassin... to actually lose a game says something. And I've heard too many stories about vamp tribal taking people by surprise to think it's just coincidence.  
  
In the precons though i... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
i would try to use him in a changeling swarm. vampires are usually rather difficult to produce in large enough numbers to make this card use full, but with token generators and cards that give your creatures changeling, you could have like 20 vamps in one turn and just snap yourself some of your opposition. i wouldn't put him in a traditional vampire deck, but building a deck around him could be fun.   
  
EDIT, i actually just did make a deck around him, BW based around stalling with cards like holy day wile i build up enough creatures and cast [Shields of Velis Vel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shields of Velis Vel)  
  
but ya, the art is horrible

posts.post_content: His special ability is devastating, but you've pretty much got to build your entire deck around him to use him. You'll need multiple copies of the card and probably several other vampires in your deck to get the most out of him, and then you'll need to find ways to protect him, because the second he comes out your opponent will be doing everything in their power to get rid of him.

Posted By: gwydion9 (9/30/2010 8:21:08 PM)

posts.post_content:
Its pretty sad that most of you are judging this card by its artwork and not what it actually does. He's a fantastic vampire; you just have to know how to play him and use him effectively. Let's start with the basics:   
  
1. He comes out a turn sooner than Vampire Nocturnus.   
  
2. He gives a **guaranteed** +1/+1 to all Vampires rather than having a 66% chance of giving +2/+1 and flying if you run a 33% land ratio, like most players do.   
  
3. He has a Mind Control ability that you can use the turn he comes in or in response to attackers. It wouldn't make sense to tap out your vampires during your turn like that.   
  
With the way my T2 vampire deck runs, he works awesomely with them. The highest cost creatures are him and Vampire Nighthawk, and on top of that there is green in the deck for mana vamp, meaning I can throw out a ton of vampires really fast, and if he isn't Pathed or removed by any other means, he can give all of them +1/+1, and if I need to, I can tap five of them to take con... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Its pretty sad that most of you are judging this card by its artwork and not what it actually does. He's a fantastic vampire; you just have to know how to play him and use him effectively. Let's start with the basics:

1. He comes out a turn sooner than Vampire Nocturnus.

2. He gives a guaranteed +1/+1 to all Vampires rather than having a 66% chance of giving +2/+1 and flying if you run a 33% land ratio, like most players do.

3. He has a Mind Control ability that you can use the turn he comes in or in response to attackers. It wouldn't make sense to tap out your vampires during your turn like that.

With the way my T2 vampire deck runs, he works awesomely with them. The highest cost creatures are him and Vampire Nighthawk, and on top of that there is green in the deck for mana vamp, meaning I can throw out a ton of vampires really fast, and if he isn't Pathed or removed by any other means, he can give all of them +1/+1, and if I need to, I can tap five of them to take con...
